intro: Centaurea pseudomicroptilon, commonly known as the slender centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, yellow to orange flowers arranged in composite heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is found in regions of southern Europe and western Asia. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while its stems are upright and branching. Centaurea pseudomicroptilon is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
